parameters.name: Review Crunchbase Update and inform your manager

parameters.content:
## 🔹 **SECTION 1: Input & Preparation 🔧✏️🧠**

### 🧩 Nodes Included:

1. 🔘 **Manual Trigger**
2. 📝 **Set Competitor Name**
3. 🧠 **Generate Crunchbase Slug**

---

### 1️⃣ 🔘 **Manual Trigger** — `Manual Trigger`

🚀 **What it does:**
This node allows you to **manually run the workflow** during testing or setup. It doesn't trigger automatically on a schedule, but gives you control to click and run whenever you want.

🧰 **Why it's useful:**
Perfect for **debugging** and **testing**. Instead of waiting for a scheduled run, you can instantly see what the workflow does.

---

### 2️⃣ 📝 **Set Competitor Name** — `Set Competitor Name`

🛠 **What it does:**
This node manually defines the company (competitor) you're tracking on Crunchbase.

🔡 **Example input:**

```json
{
  "Competitor": "Stripe, Inc."
}
```

💡 **Why it's useful:**
Allows you to customize which competitor to check — one at a time — while testing. Later, you could replace this with a list from a database or Google Sheet for full automation.

---

### 3️⃣ 🧠 **Generate Crunchbase Slug** — `Generate Crunchbase Slug`

🔄 **What it does:**
Converts the raw company name into a **Crunchbase-friendly slug** (like a web-safe name) used in the Crunchbase API call.

🔡 **Example:**

* `"Stripe, Inc."` → `"stripe-inc"`

🧠 **How it works:**

* Lowercases the text
* Removes punctuation
* Replaces spaces with hyphens (`-`)

📌 **Why it's important:**
Crunchbase’s API requires company slugs in the URL, not full names. This function ensures you get the correct format every time.

---

### ✅ **End of Section 1:**

You now have a properly formatted `slug` for a company like `openai` or `stripe-inc`, ready to query Crunchbase for real-time data.

---

## 🔹 **SECTION 2: Fetch + Create Task 📡🗂**

### 🧩 Nodes Included:

4. 🌐 **Fetch Crunchbase Data**
5. 📋 **Create Review Task in ClickUp**

---

### 4️⃣ 🌐 **Fetch Crunchbase Data** — `Fetch Crunchbase Data`

🔍 **What it does:**
Makes a real-time API call to **Crunchbase** using the generated `slug`, and pulls in key information about the company — like funding, description, homepage, and last updated date.

🔑 **Requires:** Crunchbase API Key

🔡 **Example API Call:**

```http
GET https://api.crunchbase.com/api/v4/entities/organizations/stripe-inc?user_key=YOUR_API_KEY
```

🧾 **Sample Data Retrieved:**

* `name`: Stripe
* `updated_at`: 2025-06-05T12:34:56Z
* `total_funding_usd`: 10B+
* `homepage_url`: [https://stripe.com](https://stripe.com)
* `short_description`: Online payment infrastructure

📌 **Why it's useful:**
This gives you all the relevant data about the competitor's recent activities that might be worth your team's attention.

---

### 5️⃣ 📋 **Create Review Task in ClickUp** — `Create Review Task in ClickUp`

🗂 **What it does:**
Automatically creates a new **task in ClickUp**, assigning the Crunchbase update to your team for review.

📄 **Task Includes:**

* 🏷 Title: `Review Crunchbase Update: Stripe`
* 📝 Description:

  ```text
  Company: Stripe
  Last Updated: 2025-06-05
  Description: Online payment infrastructure
  Total Funding: $10B
  Website: https://stripe.com
  ```

💡 **Why it's powerful:**
No manual tracking or checking needed — your team is alerted **automatically** when there’s something new. It ensures nothing slips through the cracks.

---

=======================================
            WORKFLOW ASSISTANCE
=======================================
For any questions or support, please contact:
    Yaron@nofluff.online

Explore more tips and tutorials here:
   - YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/@YaronBeen/videos
   - LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/yaronbeen/
=======================================

✨ **Crunchbase → ClickUp Automation**

Track competitor updates from **Crunchbase** and automatically create **ClickUp tasks** for your team to review — all in just a few clicks!

---

### 🧩 Nodes Included:

5. 📋 **Create Review Task in ClickUp**

---

🔍 **What it does:**
Makes a real-time API call to **Crunchbase** using the generated `slug`, and pulls in key information about the company — like funding, description, homepage, and last updated date.

🔑 **Requires:** Crunchbase API Key

🔡 **Example API Call:**

```http

```

🧾 **Sample Data Retrieved:**

* `name`: Stripe
* `updated_at`: 2025-06-05T12:34:56Z
* `total_funding_usd`: 10B+
* `homepage_url`: [https://stripe.com](https://stripe.com)
* `short_description`: Online payment infrastructure

📌 **Why it's useful:**

---

### 5️⃣ 📋 **Create Review Task in ClickUp** — `Create Review Task in ClickUp`

📄 **Task Includes:**

* 🏷 Title: `Review Crunchbase Update: Stripe`
* 📝 Description:

  ```text

  Last Updated: 2025-06-05
  Description: Online payment infrastructure
  Total Funding: $10B
  Website: https://stripe.com
  ```

💡 **Why it's powerful:**
No manual tracking or checking needed — your team is alerted **automatically** when there’s something new. It ensures nothing slips through the cracks.

---

## 🎯 **Final Outcome**

You now have a streamlined mini-intelligence system:

* ✅ Input a company
* 🔁 Convert it into a slug
* 📡 Fetch live data
* 📝 Create an action task for your team

All **automated**, all **within n8n** — no coding required beyond smart node usage. ✨

---

_metadata.name: Automated Competitor Intelligence: CrunchBase to ClickUp Tracking Workflow
